Agenda Report

Public Works
Commission Meeting
04-28-21
Item

To:

Chair Merrick and Members of the Public Works Commission

Prepared by:

Troy Spayd, Assistant Public Works Director/City Engineer

Date prepared: April 15, 2021

Meeting date: April 28, 2021

Subject:

Capital Improvement Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects Status
Report

RECOMMENDED ACTION: Receive and file report on the status of the City’s current and
upcoming Capital Improvements Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects.

DISCUSSION: Staff will provide a status update on the following active projects in the
Fiscal Year 2020-2021 Capital Improvement Program:

Capital Improvement Projects (Design)

Marie Canyon Green Streets
(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The City has recently received Measure W funds to complete this
project. Staff is working on the project plans to prepare for public
bidding.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer 2021

Capital Improvement Projects (Construction)

City Hall Roof Replacement

(cid:190) Updates: City staff continues to review project related material submittals.
Once submittals are approved, all materials will be ordered and shipped to
the project site. The roof ISO board membrane is on back order due to the
recent storms in Texas which halted manufacturing. The estimated material
arrival and start date is the middle of May.
(cid:190) Project Schedule: May 2021 through July 2021

Bluffs Park Workout Station

(cid:190) Updates: The contractor has completed and installed all the new workout
equipment and rubber surfacing. Remaining work includes punch list items
only.

(cid:190) Project Schedule: Estimated completion date is April 2021.

Civic Center Way Improvements

(cid:190) Updates:', metadata={'chunk_index': 4, 'source': 'data/civic/extracted_data/malibucity_agenda__04282021-1687.txt', 'start_index': 3623}), Document(page_content='Civic Center Way Improvements

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Work Hours: Monday through Friday 7:00AM to 4:00PM, Saturdays

7:00AM to 4:00PM

(cid:131) Civic Center Way was reopened to the public on April 8th. While being
open, many project related items will continue. This will include
intermittent traffic control (lane closures). The remaining items includes
final paving, striping, irrigation, painting, planting material, clean-up,
and final detailing.

(cid:190) Project Schedule: August 2020 through April 2021

Page 3 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.










Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started)

Bluffs Park Shade Structure

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of the installation of four single-post

shade structures at Malibu Bluffs Park

(cid:131) Complete Design: May 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021

PCH Median Improvements Project

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Consultant is working on the final design. In March, the City be seeking
proposals from consultants to perform construction management.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Page 1 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.


















PCH Signal Synchronization System Improvements Project

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) 65% design package was submitted to Caltrans in November 2020 and

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Final Design: May 2021
(cid:131) Advertise: July 2021
(cid:131) Award Contract and Begin Construction: September 2021

Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure

(cid:190) Updates:', metadata={'chunk_index': 1, 'source': 'data/civic/extracted_data/malibucity_agenda__04282021-1687.txt', 'start_index': 907}), Document(page_content='Trancas Canyon Park Slope Stabilization Project (CalJPIA Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project consultant has started the design of this project.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer/Fall 2021

Birdview Avenue Improvements (CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The design of this project has been included in the Malibu Park
Drainage Improvements project and updates will be provided under
that project.

Outdoor Warning Sirens (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Updates: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA after the
Wooley Fire. The project consists of hiring a consultant to develop a plan that
includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible locations. Staff is
working on an RFQ to hire a consultant for the design.

node_5.prompt:
System: You are an expert at merging sub-answers into a final answer.                 Perform query merging, given a initial question,                 a list of its sub-queries and sub-answers, merge them into a final answer.                 These sub-answers are generated correspondingly from the sub-questions that                 have been well decomposed.                 Hence you need to find an intersection between the sub-answers to generate the final answer                 for the initial question.                 If there are acronyms or words you are not familiar with, do not try to rephrase them.                Your final answer should be a well-structured and coherent response to the initial question.
